locuaz.amberutils.run_acpype(name: str, prmtop: FileHandle | Path, rst: FileHandle | Path, *, target_chains: Iterable, binder_chains: Iterable) → Tuple[GROStructure, ZipTopology][source]
locuaz.amberutils.run_tleap(tleap_script: FileHandle | Path, name: str) → Tuple[PDBStructure, FileHandle, FileHandle][source]

run_tleap(): runs tleap script and then uses a local PDB to add chainID info to the .prmtop and box info to the .rst7. Then it uses both to overwrite the PDB to keep everything in sync (in case, for example, that the tleap script added ions)

Parameters:

  • tleap_script (Union[FileHandle, Path]) script that loads a local PDB and

  • file (outputs a .prmtop and a .rst7)

  • name (str) name of the system

Returns:

PDB, .prmtop and .rst7

Return type:

Tuple[PDBStructure, FileHandle, FileHandle]

locuaz.basemutator module

class locuaz.basemutator.BaseMutator(bin_dir: Path, radius: float = 5)[source]

Bases: object

BaseMutator offers 4 static methods to help development of new mutators: split_solute_solvent(), fix_pdb(), port_mutation() and add_water(). :param bin_dir: path to the binary file. :type bin_dir: Path :param radius: radius freesasa will use to define the Ag-Ab interface. Default: 5A. :type radius: float

Raises:

static add_water(solute_path: Path | PDBStructure, solvent_path: Path | PDBStructure, out_path: Path) → PDBStructure[source]
assert_outfile(out_file: str | Path | FileHandle, *, stdout: str, stderr: str, command: str) → Path[source]
static fix_pdb(pdb_in: Path | PDBStructure) → Path[source]

Uses AA_MAP to map non-standard amino acids to standard ones (eg: CY2 to CYS) and then removes non-amino acidic molecules (eg: ZN and other ligands). This is to prevent mutators from choking on some proteins. :param pdb_in: input dried PDB without water nor ions which may contain non-standard :param residues and non-amino acidic molecules:

Returns:

PDB without non-amino acidic molecules and with standardized resnames

Return type:

Path

on_pdb(input_pdb: PDBStructure, local_dir: Path, *, mutation: Mutation, selection_complex: str | None = None, selection_wations: str | None = None) → PDBStructure[source]
static port_mutation(mutated_pdb: Path | PDBStructure, original_pdb: Path | PDBStructure, mut: Mutation, surrounding_residues: Set[Tuple[int, str, str]] | None = None) → Path[source]
static split_solute_solvent(pdb_in: PDBStructure | Path, *, selection_complex: str | None = None, selection_wations: str | None = None) → Tuple[PDBStructure, PDBStructure][source]
locuaz.basemutator.memorize_mutations(work_pjct: WorkProject, new_epoch: Epoch, mutations: Iterable[Mutation]) → None[source]

locuaz.cli module

locuaz.cli.append_iterations(sorted_iters: PriorityQueue, iterations: List, prev_epoch: int) → str[source]
locuaz.cli.backup_iteration(it_fn: str | Path) → None[source]
locuaz.cli.check_gmxmmpbsa(config: Dict) → None[source]
locuaz.cli.get_dir_size(folder: Path) → float[source]
locuaz.cli.get_memory(config: Dict) → Tuple[Set, List[List]][source]

get_memory() compares character by character of the iteration folders resnames to find differences among them that would correspond to previously done mutations. Small issue in this function: when an epoch was generated from more than 1 top iteration, the mutations performed on that epoch will be memorized and also the ones that were actually performed on a previous epoch and were already present, since it will find differences among them.

One could remove positions that are repeated in more than 1 memory slot, but its impossible to know if the cause of this was the aforementioned example, or, a previous run with a shorter memory (or no memory at all), that mutated the same position more than once in the last N (N being equal to config[protocol][memory_size]) epochs. Hence, no overlap is removed and repetitive resSeqs may be found on the resulting List of Lists.

Sets: config[misc][epoch_mutated_positions] and config[protocol][memory_positions],

Parameters:

config (Dict) input config options from the user.

Returns:

resSeqs where different AAs where found. It may be empty, when the iteration folders being proved dont have the same number of chains and the same length of residues being mutated.

Return type:

List[List[int]]

locuaz.cli.get_raw_config(config_path: str)[source]

locuaz.fixbox module

locuaz.fixbox.fix_box(uni: Universe, *, target_indices: Iterable, binder_indices: Iterable, non_protein_indices: Iterable) → Tuple[bool, Universe][source]

fix_box() wraps the atoms of a system around its box and then centers them. From: Baptista, A. M.; da Rocha, L.; Campos, S. R. R. FixBox: A General Algorithm to Fix Molecular Systems in Periodic Boxes. J. Chem. Inf. Model. 2022, 62 (18), 44354447. https://doi.org/10.1021/acs.jcim.2c00823.

Parameters:

  • uni (mda.Universe)

  • target_indices (Iterable)

  • binder_indices (Iterable)

  • non_protein_indices (Iterable)

Returns:

boolean indicating whether there are target or

binder atoms outside the box and the universe with the wrapped coords.

Return type:

Tuple[bool, mda.Universe]

locuaz.fixbox.fix_box_cpx(cpx: GROComplex, out_path: Path, gmx_bin: str = 'gmx') → Tuple[bool, PDBStructure][source]

fix_box_cpx(): fix_box() wrapper for the protocol. :param cpx: GROComplex :type cpx: GROComplex :param out_path: output PDB :type out_path: Path :param gmx_bin: GROMACS binary executable name :type gmx_bin: str

Returns:

boolean indicating whether there are target or

binder atoms outside the box and PDBStructure of the input out_path.

Return type:

Tuple[bool, PDBStructure]

locuaz.fixbox.get_matrix(dimensions)[source]

locuaz.gmxmmpbsa module

class locuaz.gmxmmpbsa.GmxMmpbsa(sf_dir, *, nthreads=2, mpiprocs=2)[source]

Bases: AbstractScoringFunction

locuaz.gromacsutils module

locuaz.gromacsutils.fix_gromacs_pdb(pdb_in_fn: Path, pdb_out_fn: Path, *, new_chainID: str | None = None, allowed_nonstandard_residues: Set | None = None) → Path[source]

fix_gromacs_pdb uses Bio to add TER between chains, END at the end, and manually make the resSeq numbers continuous. Since this changes the PBD numbering it should only be used for structures to be used for scoring. Specifically, Haddock, that requires chains to have unique resSeq numbers.

Parameters:

  • pdb_in_fn (Path) Path to input PDB.

  • pdb_out_fn (Path) Path to output PDB.

locuaz.gromacsutils.image_traj(cpx: GROComplex, out_trj_fn: Path, use_tleap: bool = False, gmx_bin: str = 'gmx') → XtcTrajectory[source]
locuaz.gromacsutils.remove_overlapping_solvent(overlapped_pdb: PDBStructure, overlapped_resSeq: int, nonoverlapped_out_pdb: Path, log: Logger, *, cutoff: float = 3, use_tleap=False) → PDBStructure[source]
locuaz.gromacsutils.remove_overlapping_waters(complex: GROComplex, config: Dict, overlapped_resSeq: int) → GROComplex[source]

DEPRECATED remove_overlapping_waters takes a complex and removes all the waters that are within a certain cutoff from overlapped_resSeq. Then it replaces them. It does a lot of gymnastics to deal with Gromacs weirdness.

Parameters:

  • config (Dict) work projects config file

  • complex (AbstractComplex) a Gromacs complex

  • overlapped_resSeq (int) assumes that this residue belongs to binder

Returns:

fully loaded complex with no overlaps between water and overlapped_resSeq

Return type:

AbstractComplex

locuaz.interface.get_interfacing_residues(pdb_input: PDBStructure | FileHandle | Path, chainIDs: List[str], probe_radius: float = 1.4, use_tleap: bool = False) → Set[int][source]

get_interfacing_residues(): use freesasa to get the resSeq of the binder residues that are in contact with the target. These can be used to guide the 2choice of the next mutated position. :param pdb_input: input PDB. :type pdb_input: Union[PDBStructure, FileHandle, Path] :param chainIDs: only residues belonging to these chains will be reported. :type chainIDs: List[str] :param probe_radius: probe_radius for freesasa :param use_tleap: if True, it will renumber the resSeqs of the input PDB (on another temporary PDB) :type use_tleap: bool :param as per Amber numbering scheme: :param that is: :param continuous resSeq numbers as opposed to GROMACS numbering: :param which starts at 1 on each chain.:

Returns:

set of resSeqs from the binder that lie on the interface

Return type:

Set[int]

locuaz.moleculesutils module

locuaz.moleculesutils.fix_wat_naming(pdb_in: PDBStructure | Path, pdb_out: Path, *, use_tleap: bool = False) → PDBStructure[source]
locuaz.moleculesutils.get_gro_ziptop_from_pdb(*, pdb: PDBStructure, target_chains: Iterable, binder_chains: Iterable, md_config: Dict, add_ions: bool = False) → Tuple[PDBStructure, GROStructure, ZipTopology][source]

get_gro_ziptop_from_pdb does a pdb2gmx from the PDB and tries to keep the system neutral, which may alter the topology so a new PDB will be written with the same name as the original, which will be backed up by GROMACS. No editconf or solvate is run. The system is assumed to have solvent and a CRYST1 record with box info.

Parameters:

  • pdb (PDBStructure) input PDB

  • target_chains (Iterable) these will be used to construct the ZipTopology

  • binder_chains (Iterable) these will be used to construct the ZipTopology

  • md_config (Dict) users config input

  • add_ions (bool) wether to neutralize with genion or not. Useful after a mutation was done on the

  • PDB. (input)

Returns:

Proper, nice, system.

Return type:

Tuple[PDBStructure, GROStructure, ZipTopology]

locuaz.moleculesutils.get_gro_ziptop_from_pdb_tleap(*, pdb: PDBStructure, target_chains: Iterable, binder_chains: Iterable) → Tuple[PDBStructure, GROStructure, ZipTopology][source]

get_gro_ziptop_from_pdb_tleap runs .

  • target_chains (Iterable) these will be used to construct the ZipTopology

  • binder_chains (Iterable) these will be used to construct the ZipTopology

Returns:

Proper, nice, system.

Return type:

Tuple[PDBStructure, GROStructure, ZipTopology]

Creates scoring folder inside the iteration dir, fixes PBC issues with the original NPT trajectory to create a fix_{name}.xtc trajectory and a fix_{name}.pdb. target and binder will get chainIDs of A and B, no matter their original chainIDs or number of chains. This is to prevent scoring functions from choking. :param iteration: Iteration object :type iteration: Iteration :param config: input config file :type config: dict :param log: logger :type log: logging.Logger

locuaz.validatore module

class locuaz.validatore.Validatore(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Validator

Validator class. Normalizes and/or validates any mapping against a validation-schema which is provided as an argument at class instantiation or upon calling the validate(), validated() or normalized() method. An instance itself is callable and executes a validation.

All instantiation parameters are optional.

There are the introspective properties types, validators, coercers, default_setters, rules, normalization_rules and validation_rules.

The attributes reflecting the available rules are assembled considering constraints that are defined in the docstrings of rules methods and is effectively used as validation schema for schema.

Parameters:

  • schema (any mapping) See schema. Defaults to None.

  • ignore_none_values (bool) See ignore_none_values. Defaults to False.

  • allow_unknown (bool or any mapping) See allow_unknown. Defaults to False.

  • require_all (bool) See require_all. Defaults to False.

  • purge_unknown (bool) See purge_unknown. Defaults to to False.

  • purge_readonly (bool) Removes all fields that are defined as readonly in the normalization phase.

  • error_handler (class or instance based on BaseErrorHandler or tuple) The error handler that formats the result of errors. When given as two-value tuple with an error-handler class and a dictionary, the latter is passed to the initialization of the error handler. Default: BasicErrorHandler.

checkers = ()
coercers = ()
default_setters = ()
normalization_rules = {'coerce': {'oneof': [{'type': 'callable'}, {'type': 'list', 'schema': {'oneof': [{'type': 'callable'}, {'type': 'string', 'allowed': ()}]}}, {'type': 'string', 'allowed': ()}]}, 'default': {'nullable': True}, 'default_setter': {'oneof': [{'type': 'callable'}, {'type': 'string', 'allowed': ()}]}, 'purge_unknown': {'type': 'boolean'}, 'rename': {'type': 'hashable'}, 'rename_handler': {'oneof': [{'type': 'callable'}, {'type': 'list', 'schema': {'oneof': [{'type': 'callable'}, {'type': 'string', 'allowed': ()}]}}, {'type': 'string', 'allowed': ()}]}}
